name: Summarize
description: This is a utility EM to make summaries of data within a project. This EM is based off the summarize plugin.

project-settings.name:
Organize project fields into an easy-to-read table
This tool allows users to format data from your project into an easy-to-read table structure. Summarize uses the configuration specified below to determine which fields to include and how to display the data. HTML is generated for each record and each configuration and the html is stored in a project field that is specified in the configuration. The html can then be piped to a descriptive field to be displayed on a project form or can be used to pipe project information into emails or surveys.

The data that can be used in a Summarize table is confined to project fields in the same event. If you would like to display project fields across events or fields from another project, please use the Data Table External Module instead.

sub_settings.name:
Event id where the data is located
Must include both source and destination fields

Field where the summarized data will be stored (either 'text' or 'textarea' field)
NOTE: You will also need a field to display the piped results.

Title for summarize block
Alternately you can add a title before you pipe in the result

List of forms to include
A commas-separated list of form names

List of individual fields to include
A comma-separated list of fields (in addition to above forms)

List of fields to exclude (from the list of forms to include)
A comma-separated list of fields to exclude

Exclude form completion statuses
When checked, the form completion statuses will automatically be removed.

Display options for this configuration
The following options are used for the display. They allow users to have some control over the layout of the display table.
Display field values under field names
Field label width (left column)
Max characters for new row

Force Refresh
When selected, all records using this Summarize configuration will be refreshed.

project-settings.name:
Project Debugging Option
This will allow for extra debugging statements to be written to the project log files for the whole project - not just one configuration.

Enable Debug Logging (Requires emLogger)
If you have questions enabling debugging, please contact the REDCap team for help.
